@graph.description: The best homemade Apple Crumble Pie recipe uses only a few ingredients and is made from scratch - the perfect fall pie for Thanksgiving.

itemListElement.name: Home
Best Apple Crumble Pie

@graph.name: What is crumble topping made of?

acceptedAnswer.text: It depends on the recipe, however, this recipe has granulated sugar, all-purpose flour, butter softened, ground cinnamon, and sea salt.

@graph.name: What apples are good for apple crumble pie?

acceptedAnswer.text: I really like a tart variety like Granny smith or pink lady, but all varieties work well.

@graph.name: How do you prevent a soggy bottom pie crust?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Be sure to use a colander to let the water drain out of your apples as they cool before mixing the dry ingredients into them.
Let the apple pie cool completely before serving. This will thicken up the filling and harden the crust. 
Do not add any excess water to the pie when you add the filling.

@graph.name: Apple Crumble Pie
@graph.description: The best homemade Apple Crumble Pie recipe uses only a few ingredients and is made completely from scratch! It's the perfect fall dessert! Gluten-free & vegan options!

video.name: Apple Crumble Pie
video.description: This is the best homemade Apple Crumble Pie recipe! It uses only a few ingredients and is made completely from scratch! It’s the perfect fall dessert, and a great addition to your Thanksgiving table!

recipeIngredient: ½ cup unsalted butter (COLD, cut into 1 inch pieces (Vegan Option: Earth Balance))

itemListElement.text: Place the flour, salt, and sugar in a food processor fitted with an “S” blade and pulse to combine.
itemListElement.name: Place the flour, salt, and sugar in a food processor fitted with an “S” blade and pulse to combine.

itemListElement.text: Add the butter (or earth balance) and cold water and process until the mixture resembles a coarse meal, begins to stick together, and holds together when pinched.
itemListElement.name: Add the butter (or earth balance) and cold water and process until the mixture resembles a coarse meal, begins to stick together, and holds together when pinched.

itemListElement.text: Remove dough from processor (will be crumbly) and form into a ball.
itemListElement.name: Remove dough from processor (will be crumbly) and form into a ball.

itemListElement.text: Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 15 minutes or overnight.
itemListElement.name: Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 15 minutes or overnight.

itemListElement.text: In a small bowl, mix together sugar, flour, cinnamon and salt until combined.
itemListElement.name: In a small bowl, mix together sugar, flour, cinnamon and salt until combined.

itemListElement.text: Cut in butter with a fork, a pastry cutter, or your hands until crumbly.
itemListElement.name: Cut in butter with a fork, a pastry cutter, or your hands until crumbly.

itemListElement.text: Set aside.
itemListElement.name: Set aside.

itemListElement.text: Place your peeled and cored apples in a microwave safe dish and heat for 5 minutes, until apples are slightly soft to the touch.
itemListElement.name: Place your peeled and cored apples in a microwave safe dish and heat for 5 minutes, until apples are slightly soft to the touch.

itemListElement.text: While apples are in the microwave, in a small bowl, mix together sugar, flour cinnamon and nutmeg.
itemListElement.name: While apples are in the microwave, in a small bowl, mix together sugar, flour cinnamon and nutmeg.

itemListElement.text: Once apples are finished cooking in the microwave, drain any excess water.
itemListElement.name: Once apples are finished cooking in the microwave, drain any excess water.

itemListElement.text: Add ½ of the dry mixture to the soft apples and stir to coat the apples.
itemListElement.name: Add ½ of the dry mixture to the soft apples and stir to coat the apples.

itemListElement.text: Add the rest of the dry ingredients and mix until the apples are evenly coated.
itemListElement.name: Add the rest of the dry ingredients and mix until the apples are evenly coated.

itemListElement.text: Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
itemListElement.name: Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.

itemListElement.text: Remove crust from refrigerator and roll into a circle, about ¼ to ½ inches thick. (if it has been refrigerated overnight you will need to let it sit on the counter at room temperature until it is pliable).
itemListElement.name: Remove crust from refrigerator and roll into a circle, about ¼ to ½ inches thick. (if it has been refrigerated overnight you will need to let it sit on the counter at room temperature until it is pliable).

itemListElement.text: Gently place crust into pie plate, forming it to look how you would like!
itemListElement.name: Gently place crust into pie plate, forming it to look how you would like!

itemListElement.text: Pour filling into unbaked pie crust.
itemListElement.name: Pour filling into unbaked pie crust.

itemListElement.text: Use your hands to evenly sprinkle the crumb topping over the filling.
itemListElement.name: Use your hands to evenly sprinkle the crumb topping over the filling.

itemListElement.text: Place a pie crust shield or aluminum foil over the outer crust of your pie to protect it from burning. Remove shield in the last 10-15 minutes of baking if it doesn’t begin to brown under the shield)
itemListElement.name: Place a pie crust shield or aluminum foil over the outer crust of your pie to protect it from burning. Remove shield in the last 10-15 minutes of baking if it doesn’t begin to brown under the shield)

itemListElement.text: Bake your pie in the preheated oven for 45-60 minutes, or until the filling begins to bubble and the top is lightly browned.
itemListElement.name: Bake your pie in the preheated oven for 45-60 minutes, or until the filling begins to bubble and the top is lightly browned.

itemListElement.text: Let cool for at least 1 hour and dig in!
itemListElement.name: Let cool for at least 1 hour and dig in!
